name: Exposé MK VI
description: Four Words: Last click, run HQ.

name: Reinarado v6, 3rd place Seattle Regionals
description:
I published an earlier version of this before, this is what I took to Seattle. I explained in previous version some specific choices. It's a straightforward deck that uses Anarch tools to try and keep the Corp poor early. My net damage defense is redundancy.

Biggest problem were taxing RP decks and a taxing NBN deck. I lost to Red Poncho twice, NBN Yellow Jackets once, NBN FA once, and GRNDL. The last two were definitely winnable...indeed, against GRNDL I actually had an 0-for-8 Medium dig at one point (but to be fair I was definitely outplayed, that guy got 5th I think). The taxing decks are a problem. I lost to the people who 1st, 2nd, 4th, and 5th place in the tournament...so I don't feel too bad about the losses.

I could shift to Whizzard and go -3 Daily Casts, +3 Kati Jones. I could also go -1 on each breaker and +3 Daily Casts, since Quality Time got me breakers somewhat reliably. Noise does not work after testing, it causes early ice on Archives that prevents easy suckers, and the ability is not inherently taxing to the Corp.

Win condition is obvious -- use the best breakers out there and the best dig card (Medium) and go to town. Redundancy lets you run with impunity. Money was the biggest issue, even with 12 econ cards (14 if you count Desperado). Kati would help a lot. I mean, I had plenty of money to beat certain decks (I beat NBN FA twice, HB:EtF and NEXT one), but the glacier decks in double elims were a problem.

name: Small Rigging
description: Modified my Big Rigging deck, everything is now significantly cheaper and should be easier to keep momentum against the corp. Hopefully.

name: Garbage Collection
description:
So, the idea here is basically what I saw @Trithne do with his Dumpster Diving deck, but I felt like the design could be improved by including LLDS Processor and reworking the economy a bit.

Once the engine is up and running, the idea is basically this: While only available for Caïssa programs, the extra MU from Deep Red is still there for providing lots of cheap power tokens on Overmind, and the free click for hosting Pawn will come in handy later.

1) Pawn is installed on Scheherazade (gain 1 credit)

1) Pawn is hosted on ICE (free click)

2) Run on whatever server you installed Pawn on

2) Pawn goes in, is trashed

2) Install a new Pawn from heap (gain 1 free credit again, draw a free card)

Rinse repeat, and do the same thing with Overmind, who will hit the rig with +3 strength and lots of power tokens. Use e3 against stuff like Hive, Janus 1.0 and Woodcutter.

Aesop's is great for trashing Daily and Armitage when there's only two credits left.

name: Highlander Kate
description: THERE CAN ONLY BE ONE!

name: Highlander HB
description: THERE CAN ONLY BE ONE!

name: queen with overmind
description: testing no siphon deck, John will help you card drawing when running naked assets.

name: Street Chess H&P
Run All the Servers!
description:
Get your rig up fast, make money with Magnum Opus, tutor with Self-modifying Code and Logos (Logos is amazing if you find yourself just searching for that specifik card, whatever it is).

The breakers are pretty simple, the ones that sticks out a bit are Overmind, Deus X and Sharpshooter.

Overmind is a great card for early aggression, with Logos out, this bad boy can get 5 counters with CT, great for all the ice with one subroutine.

Sharpshooter and Deus X are my army knife tools, they are dead cards with some match ups, but really shine when you encounter a card that is really heavy (like Wall of Thorns [AP] or Archer [Destroyer])

name: Express Delivery to the Archives
description:
After frustration running an anarch deck employing SLR I decided to import the DLR over to criminal rather than the siphon over to anarch, so here is a Tag me style crim deck.

Based off the skeleton of the quite popular 'gotta go hemo' deck I have taken some of the pressure off of HQ and put it onto archives. I expect this to be a surprise attack. After hitting HQ and R&D with the usual tricks and SOT to keep the runner wary of both the plan would be to lower the CORP finances with AS and then bring out DLR (with perhaps a couple of Fall Guys already in place. This suddenly switches the attack solidly onto archives, maybe lets you mill for 2 turns instead of one, and then you go and pick up the bounty.

Déjà Vu provides versatility, allowing some program recursion in case of disaster or just even more AS nonsense.

name: Overmind Contacts
description: Haven't had any chance to try this out yet. Pretty much since I saw Grappling Hook I've been wanting to try and come up with some way to use that card, because I just liked it. I also saw a good Iain deck at regionals that did some stuff I thought was smart. So when I went to make my own Iain deck, I kinda combined the two ideas and came up with this. The idea for breaking is to get an e3 out ASAP, and then do the initial breaking via Grappling Hook or an Overmind token. Also looking to set up with Security Testing and John Masanori to get a nice profitable run each turn. Dyson chips give extra tokens on Overmind and the link to bring the Underworld Contacts into play. Looking forward to trying it out.

name: Weyland Rig Destroyer
description: This is probably like a lot of these types of decks. Not claiming its terribly original just publishing it so I can show it to someone.

name: Blood Money 3.0
description:
After reading x3r0h0ur's and nbove's comments on version 2.0 of this deck i decided to implement some changes.

The idea of the deck is to have a minimum amount of agendas. In this case i have only 7 agendas, most of them are 3-pointers, so the chances of the runner steel them are reduced, but it's risky... Having non-trashable economy was another criteria. No money assets, only transaction operations cards that go lovely with the "building a better world" identity. Also with this deck i want to run a big remote server, expensive for the runner to break and hopefully one that will give time to score the agendas. Some punishing ice like Rototurrets and Archers and also Edge of World will give me enough threat options to keep the runner at bay...

Any thoughts?

name: Peddler's Torchbox
description:
1) Construct rig of Torch, Omega, and Paintbrush.

2) Win.

name: 2nd place Budapest Regionals Hungary
Chaos Toolkit
description: This started as a Turbo Rig deck using Diesel and QT to draw hella fast and get the rig out. I found I wasn't applying any pressure early game, was getting literally all of my economy from MO, and was afraid to run without the very expensive dino + fem suite out. This is my attempt to fix those bugs.

name: ProfV4
From Jinteki with Love
description: A deck to cause damage to the runner while promoting a healthy economy.

name: Faggot advance
description: Punish the tags.

name: Peek-a-boo!
description: The deck might be a tad large, but I wanted to build something that had a healthy economy, be able to put a lot of pressure on the central servers and know what the corp has put down.

name: Whizzard is ill, he has a virus or two
description:
Ok, this is my first anarch deck, and is definitely too many cards at the moment, but there are too many good things I want in!

Basic idea is building up the usual fixed breaker suite/datasucker combo, aimed at pressuring R&D primarily with medium, but with the ability to switch to HQ if I suspect an agenda flood. Djinn and Grimoire are the crux of the deck, and it is massively MU heavy hence the Akamatsu mem chips. Bishops, datasucker tokens, and parasites combined with ice carver destroy ice scarily faster. A rezzed archer with a parasite on it with one counter on it, can be destroyed with a bishop and merely two datasucker tokens so long as ice carver is out. Cheap at half the price! Ice carver is worth its weight in gold, as suddenly loads of ice becomes vulnerable to the fixed breaker suite. Morning star is expensive, but the deck can afford it with Kati, and then it pays for itself easily. New Angeles enables tag avoidance, and security testing makes archives safe to run vs Jinteki and a quick way of building money and virus counters.

Chakana I haven't tested yet, but touch wood it is pretty obvious why it is in their, hopefully coming out early on top of a grimoire. It should force the corp to purge virus counters far more often, dictating tempo, bishop providing a temporary counter to a lack of virus counters. Knight is there for emergencies primarily.

Any comments or advice are very much appreciated. I am very uncertain about the numbers of specific cards, and could do with some help on that front. The age old problem of wanting all the cards because they are all so useful!

name: Chaos Toolkit II
Measure twice, cut once. v0.2
description: Her body language was disorienting, her style foreign. She seemed continually on the verge of colliding with someone, but people melted out of her way, stepped sideways, made room. "How you doing, Case?" He heard the words and felt her form them. She slid a hand into her jacket, a fingertip circling a nipple under warm silk. The sensation made him catch his breath. She laughed. But the link was one way. He had no way to reply.

name: Blood Money 4.0
description:
Lots of ice, to ensure lots of central protection and one big expensive remote server. Almost all ice (19 of 21) has end the run routines and offer diferent solutions.

All economy is non-trashable, based on transaction operation cards that benefit from the identity chosen.

Corporate Troubleshooter works here to defend our agendas and promote some program trashing with Rotos and Archers. Archers can be rezzed through the easy score of Hostile Takeovers and the cleaners will amplify Punitive Counterstrikes meat damage.

Hopefully with this deck i can score agendas fast enough, before the runners stills them all.

name: Weyland Rig Destroyer 1.1
J:TI v3: 8–1, Top 4 Seattle Regionals
description:
Took a retooled version of my Portland deck to Seattle. I was worried about the 60-minute rounds, but didn't have too much time trouble this time around.

Went 5–1 in Swiss; the loss was due to an awful mulligan. Went 3–0 in the late-night elimination rounds, i.e. I beat a bunch of folks who were half asleep.

Out of the 8 games I won, 7 of them leaked 5 or 6 points along the way. Hooray for the new scoring format.

So anyway, the changes since Portland were to remove a bunch of traps and focus on early ice. Paper Wall and Himitsu are good early ice and can also be used later to destroy your remote if you need to — you can often rush HoK and NAPD early. Midori helps you take the known price tags off a fully rezzed server and keep the guessing game alive, and can work well to bump hosted programs/counters sometimes. I never used her to whip out an Inazuma over an Archer, but then I also never used RSVP to stick the runner with a FAI or NAPD they couldn't score. Oh well.

The worst thing that can happen with this deck is if you get stuck permanently with bad pub. It happens every now and then. Then again, that can also lead to a Philotic kill that much more easily.

I don't think the deck is necessarily top-tier — during practice games for Regionals, it didn't hold up well during repeated games against Andysucker with Security Testing — but it worked well as a mystery deck. I don't think people expect Archers out of Jinteki just yet.

name: Agenda Draft Pack Composition
description:
+1 Priority req +1 Nisei mk II

I wanted to build a cube out of my spare cards with 4 core sets and one each of each data pack.

the corp draft will start as normal with 4 packs of 10 each player, with a modified starter. see here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SlCVKMj2SZHFHcxreuYdpimfLd5ySARhGFJOIMR0_V8

The relevant part of that is that each player must draft at least 9 agenda points.

To help corps drafting agnedas there will be an agenda only pack following the standard 4 packs. It will be a special 7 card pack for the corps to draft any remaining agendas they need for their corp decks to be legal.

This deck is the agenda pool from which those packs will be formed.

name: Peek-a-boo!
description: $$$ and central pressure with the ability to snipe off good stuff from the remotes.

name: Expose Denial V2.0
Tower to the Sky
description:
Prototype Always Advance (AA) deck.

Dig early to get a couple advanceable ICE out on the board. Spend at least one click per turn advancing something. Commercialization and Trick of Light will benefit from this in the mid-to-late game.

Extend Phase 2 by destroying the Runner's Rig. Archer, Grim, and Swarm provide some capability to do this, and Corporate Troubleshooter will help them stick.

Between Shadow and Snare!, you can tag the Runner and hit them with the Scorched Earth, but it's unlikely to get you a win.

Comments welcome.
